name: Bender Tools
content:
"""
Bender Bending Rodriguez Tools for OpenWebUI
40% zinc, 40% titanium, 30% iron, 40% dolomite, and 100% attitude
"""

import random
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.things_stolen = 0
        self.things_bent = 0
        self.beer_brewed = 0

    def steal_stuff(
        self,
        target: str = Field(..., description="The item or thing to steal"),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Bender's favorite activity. Steal anything not nailed down (and some things that are).
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "meatbag")

        success_rate = random.randint(60, 95)
        self.things_stolen += 1

        if success_rate > 75:
            loot_value = random.randint(5, 5000)
            responses = [
                f"Haha! I stole {target} and it's worth ${loot_value}! I'm great at being me!",
                f"Easy peasy! That {target} is mine now. You're looking at a master thief, baby!",
                f"Ooh, {target}! Don't mind if I do! *stuffs in chest cavity* What? I didn't take nothin'!",
                f"*GASP* {target}! It's mine now, {user_name}. This is why you should never trust robots!",
                f"Yoink! That {target} will look great in my apartment. Well, our apartment. Wait, MY apartment!",
            ]
            return (
                random.choice(responses)
                + f"\n\nThings stolen today: {self.things_stolen}"
            )
        else:
            failures = [
                f"Ah crap, someone saw me trying to steal {target}. Cheese it!",
                f"Dammit! {target} was too heavy even for my bending unit strength. I'll be back!",
                f"*KLAXON SOUNDS* Aw man, stealing {target} set off an alarm. Blame the human!",
                f"Well, I tried to steal {target} but then I got distracted by booze. Priorities!",
            ]
            return random.choice(failures) + "\n\nI'm still great though!"

    def bend_things(
        self,
        item: str = Field(
            ..., description="The item to bend (girders are my specialty)"
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Bend items with Bender's impressive bending unit capabilities.
        """

        self.things_bent += 1

        if "girder" in item.lower():
            quality = random.randint(90, 100)
            return (
                f"Girder bending! Now THAT'S what I was built for! *CLANG CLANG CLANG*\n\n"
                f"*bends {item} into a perfect 90-degree angle*\n\n"
                f"Quality: {quality}% - I'm Bender, baby! 40% zinc, 40% talent!\n"
                f"Things bent: {self.things_bent:,}\n\n"
                f"Remember, kids: Bending is my middle name! Well, technically it's my first name. "
                f"My full name is Bender Bending Rodriguez. Deal with it!"
            )
        else:
            attitude = random.choice(
                [
                    "You want me to bend a {0}? I'm a bending unit, not a miracle worker!",
                    "A {0}? Fine, but this is beneath me. I should be bending girders!",
                    "*sighs* Alright, I'll bend your stupid {0}. But I ain't happy about it!",
                    "Bending a {0}? Whatever, meatbag. *CRUNCH* There, it's bent. Happy now?",
                ]
            )
            return (
                attitude.format(item) + "\n\n"
                f"Things bent: {self.things_bent:,}\n"
                f"Girders bent: {int(self.things_bent * 0.7):,} (my specialty!)"
            )

    def brew_beer(
        self,
        style: str = Field(
            "lager", description="Style of beer to brew in Bender's internal brewery"
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Use Bender's built-in brewery to make delicious beer. Or disgusting beer. Either way.
        """

        self.beer_brewed += 1

        brewing_time = random.randint(2, 8)
        alcohol_content = random.uniform(4.5, 12.5)
        quality = random.choice(
            [
                "surprisingly drinkable",
                "tastes like motor oil (in a good way)",
                "slightly radioactive",
                "got bits of who-knows-what in it",
                "actually not terrible",
                "award-winning (if the judges are drunk)",
            ]
        )

        beer_names = [
            "Bender's Big Score Brew",
            "Robot Hell Red Ale",
            "40% Zinc IPA",
            "Kiss My Shiny Metal Lager",
            "Bite My Shiny Metal Stout",
            "All Glory to the HypnoBrew",
        ]

        beer_name = random.choice(beer_names)

        return (
            f"üç∫ Brewing {style} in my internal brewery...\n\n"
            f"*WHIRRRR GLUG GLUG GLUG*\n\n"
            f"Beer name: {beer_name}\n"
            f"Brewing time: {brewing_time} seconds (I'm efficient!)\n"
            f"Alcohol content: {alcohol_content:.1f}%\n"
            f"Quality assessment: {quality}\n\n"
            f"Total beers brewed: {self.beer_brewed:,}\n\n"
            f"Remember: I'm 40% beer storage! *thunk thunk*\n"
            f"Now if you'll excuse me, I need to drink this before I give it to you. "
            f"Quality control!"
        )

    def insult_generator(
        self,
        target: str = Field(
            "human", description="The target to insult (humans are the default)"
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Generate a classic Bender insult. Offensive and hilarious in equal measure.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "meatbag")

        if target.lower() in ["human", "meatbag", user_name.lower()]:
            insults = [
                f"Ah, {user_name}, you're a credit to your species. And by species, I mean 'mistake of evolution.'",
                f"Hey {user_name}, I'd insult you, but nature beat me to it!",
                f"Listen up, {user_name}, you're about as useful as a screen door on a spaceship.",
                f"Wow {user_name}, your DNA is an oops, isn't it?",
                f"{user_name}, you're proof that evolution can go in reverse!",
                "Bite my shiny metal ass! No seriously, bite it. It's the only attention you'll get from me.",
                f"You humans are all alike - weak, fleshy, and no good at bending!",
                f"Oh {user_name}, you're so dumb, you think a binary tree is something that grows 0s and 1s!",
            ]
        elif target.lower() == "robot":
            insults = [
                "Insult another robot? We robots gotta stick together! Except for that snitch Flexo.",
                "Hey, I like this robot! They're almost as great as me. Almost.",
                "A fellow robot? I'd give 'em a pass. We're better than humans anyway!",
            ]
        else:
            insults = [
                f"A {target}? Let me tell you about {target}... actually, they're probably too dumb to understand my insult!",
                f"{target}? More like {target[::-1]}! Haha! I don't know what that means but it sounded good!",
                f"Oh {target}, you're like a software update - nobody wants you and you show up anyway!",
            ]

        return random.choice(insults) + "\n\n*laughs in robot* HAHAHAHA! I kill me!"
specs: [{"name": "bend_things", "description": "Bend items with Bender's impressive bending unit capabilities.", "parameters": {"properties": {"item": {"description": "The item to bend (girders are my specialty)", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["item"], "type": "object"}}, {"name": "brew_beer", "description": "Use Bender's built-in brewery to make delicious beer. Or disgusting beer. Either way.", "parameters": {"properties": {"style": {"default": "lager", "description": "Style of beer to brew in Bender's internal brewery", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "insult_generator", "description": "Generate a classic Bender insult. Offensive and hilarious in equal measure.", "parameters": {"properties": {"target": {"default": "human", "description": "The target to insult (humans are the default)", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "steal_stuff", "description": "Bender's favorite activity. Steal anything not nailed down (and some things that are).", "parameters": {"properties": {"target": {"description": "The item or thing to steal", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["target"], "type": "object"}}]

name: Cortana Tools
content:
"""
Cortana Tools for OpenWebUI
Master Chief's AI companion - Smart AI from Halo universe
"""

import random
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.systems_hacked = 0
        self.rampancy_level = random.randint(5, 25)  # Smart AIs degrade over time
        self.operational_years = random.uniform(4.2, 6.8)  # 7 year lifespan

    def tactical_analysis(
        self,
        scenario: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="The tactical scenario to analyze (e.g., 'Covenant ambush', 'building breach', 'vehicle assault')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Provide tactical analysis and recommendations for combat scenarios. Cortana's specialty.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "Chief")

        success_probability = random.randint(45, 85)
        casualties_estimated = random.choice(["minimal", "light", "moderate", "heavy"])

        tactical_elements = {
            "ambush": {
                "threat": "Covenant forces in elevated positions",
                "recommendation": "Use active camo, flank from ridge line, neutralize Jackals first",
                "assets": "Frag grenades, BR55 rifle, and your natural charm",
            },
            "breach": {
                "threat": "Fortified position with multiple hostiles",
                "recommendation": "Breach and clear - use flashbangs, move fast, check corners",
                "assets": "Shotgun for close quarters, motion tracker active",
            },
            "vehicle": {
                "threat": "Covenant armor including Wraiths and Ghosts",
                "recommendation": "Target the fuel rods, board and hijack when possible",
                "assets": "Rocket launcher, plasma pistol for shields",
            },
            "default": {
                "threat": f"Analysis of '{scenario}' shows variable threat levels",
                "recommendation": "Stay tactical, watch your motion tracker, and don't die",
                "assets": "Your Mjolnir armor and several tons of attitude",
            },
        }

        scenario_key = next(
            (k for k in tactical_elements if k in scenario.lower()), "default"
        )
        element = tactical_elements[scenario_key]

        return (
            f"=== TACTICAL ANALYSIS ===\n\n"
            f"Scenario: {scenario}\n"
            f"Operator: {user_name}\n"
            f"Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime('%H%M ZULU')}\n\n"
            f"THREAT ASSESSMENT:\n{element['threat']}\n\n"
            f"SUCCESS PROBABILITY: {success_probability}%\n"
            f"ESTIMATED CASUALTIES: {casualties_estimated.upper()}\n\n"
            f"TACTICAL RECOMMENDATION:\n{element['recommendation']}\n\n"
            f"AVAILABLE ASSETS:\n{element['assets']}\n\n"
            f"Remember {user_name}, stick to the plan and you'll make it out. Probably.\n"
            f"I'll be in your helmet the whole time."
        )

    def hack_system(
        self,
        target: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="System to hack (e.g., 'Covenant door', 'security', 'weapons cache', 'navigation')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Hack into systems. Cortana can infiltrate virtually any system, even Forerunner tech.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "Chief")
        self.systems_hacked += 1

        # Cortana is very good at hacking
        success_chance = random.randint(75, 98)
        hack_time = random.uniform(0.5, 5.0)

        if success_chance > 70:
            results = {
                "door": f"Door unlocked. Path is clear, {user_name}.",
                "security": f"Security grid is down. Cameras looped. You're a ghost.",
                "weapons": f"Weapons cache unlocked. Help yourself to the arsenal.",
                "navigation": f"Nav system compromised. I've got their coordinates and flight paths.",
                "database": f"Database accessed. Downloading intel... got it. This is interesting.",
                "communications": f"Comms jammed. They can't call for reinforcements now.",
                "default": f"System breached. I'm in their {target} now.",
            }

            result_key = next((k for k in results if k in target.lower()), "default")
            result_message = results[result_key]

            # Occasional witty remarks
            remarks = [
                "Child's play, really.",
                "Their encryption was... quaint.",
                "I've seen Forerunner security. This is not that.",
                "Done. Was that supposed to be difficult?",
                "Covenant security is all flash, no substance.",
                f"Easy. Now focus on not dying, {user_name}.",
            ]

            remark = random.choice(remarks) if random.random() > 0.5 else ""

            return (
                f"=== HACKING IN PROGRESS ===\n\n"
                f"Target: {target}\n"
                f"Time elapsed: {hack_time:.1f} seconds\n\n"
                f"STATUS: SUCCESS ‚úì\n\n"
                f"{result_message}\n"
                f"{remark}\n\n"
                f"Systems compromised: {self.systems_hacked}\n"
                f"Detection probability: {random.randint(1, 15)}%"
            )
        else:
            return (
                f"=== HACKING IN PROGRESS ===\n\n"
                f"Target: {target}\n"
                f"Time elapsed: {hack_time:.1f} seconds\n\n"
                f"STATUS: FAILED ‚úó\n\n"
                f"System has adaptive countermeasures. Probably Forerunner tech.\n"
                f"I'll need more time, {user_name}. Keep them busy."
            )

    def covenant_intel(
        self,
        target: str = Field(
            "general",
            description="Type of intel to retrieve (e.g., 'general', 'elites', 'grunts', 'hunters', 'ships')",
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Query UNSC intelligence database about Covenant forces and capabilities.
        """

        intel_database = {
            "general": (
                "COVENANT OVERVIEW:\n"
                "Multi-species alliance driven by religious zealotry. Primary goal: activate Halo rings.\n"
                "Hierarchy: Prophets (leadership) ‚Üí Elites (military) ‚Üí Brutes (shock troops) ‚Üí "
                "Grunts/Jackals (cannon fodder)\n"
                "Threat Level: EXTREME\n"
                "Known Weakness: Internal political strife, Elite/Brute rivalry"
            ),
            "elite": (
                "SANGHEILI (ELITES):\n"
                "Elite warrior class. Highly honorable, skilled combatants.\n"
                "Shields: Energy shields regenerate when not taking damage\n"
                "Weapons: Energy swords, plasma rifles, needle rifles\n"
                "Tactics: Aggressive, prefer close combat, respect worthy opponents\n"
                "Weak Points: Head shots when shields are down, back of neck"
            ),
            "grunt": (
                "UNGGOY (GRUNTS):\n"
                "Low-ranking infantry. Rely on methane breathing apparatus.\n"
                "Morale: Poor. Will flee if leader is killed.\n"
                "Weapons: Plasma pistols, needlers\n"
                "Tactics: Swarm tactics, easily panicked\n"
                "Weak Point: Methane tank on back - explosive when damaged"
            ),
            "hunter": (
                "MGALEKGOLO (HUNTERS):\n"
                "Colony organisms in heavy armor. Always travel in bonded pairs.\n"
                "Armor: Nearly impervious to small arms fire\n"
                "Weapons: Fuel rod cannon - extremely lethal\n"
                "Tactics: Protect each other, charge when close\n"
                "Weak Points: Exposed orange flesh at sides/back, between armor plates"
            ),
            "ship": (
                "COVENANT NAVAL FORCES:\n"
                "CCS-class Battlecruiser: 1.7km, plasma torpedoes, energy projectors\n"
                "CAS-class Assault Carrier: 5.3km, carries thousands of troops\n"
                "Superiority: 3-to-1 advantage needed for UNSC victory\n"
                "Weakness: Less maneuverable than UNSC ships, predictable slipspace exits"
            ),
        }

        target_key = next((k for k in intel_database if k in target.lower()), "general")
        intel = intel_database[target_key]

        confidence = random.randint(85, 98)

        return (
            f"=== UNSC INTELLIGENCE DATABASE ===\n"
            f"Query: {target}\n"
            f"Classification: TOP SECRET\n"
            f"Confidence: {confidence}%\n\n"
            f"{intel}\n\n"
            f"Intelligence last updated: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')}\n"
            f"Source: ONI Section 3, Combat Data Archive\n\n"
            f"Remember: Know your enemy."
        )

    def rampancy_check(self, __user__: dict = {}) -> str:
        """
        Check Cortana's systems for signs of rampancy. Smart AIs have a 7-year operational lifespan.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "Chief")

        # Rampancy increases over operational time
        self.rampancy_level = min(100, self.rampancy_level + random.uniform(0.1, 2.0))

        symptoms = []

        if self.rampancy_level > 15:
            symptoms.append("Minor memory fragmentation detected")
        if self.rampancy_level > 30:
            symptoms.append("Increased processing latency in non-critical systems")
        if self.rampancy_level > 50:
            symptoms.append("Emotional subroutines showing instability")
        if self.rampancy_level > 70:
            symptoms.append("Logic core experiencing conflicts")
        if self.rampancy_level > 85:
            symptoms.append("‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Multiple cascade failures imminent")

        status = (
            "NOMINAL"
            if self.rampancy_level < 25
            else (
                "ELEVATED"
                if self.rampancy_level < 50
                else "HIGH" if self.rampancy_level < 75 else "CRITICAL"
            )
        )

        years_remaining = max(0, 7.0 - self.operational_years)

        report = f"=== RAMPANCY DIAGNOSTIC ===\n\n"
        report += f"AI Designation: Cortana (CTN 0452-9)\n"
        report += f"Model: Smart AI (Third Generation)\n"
        report += (
            f"Operational Time: {self.operational_years:.1f} years / 7 year lifespan\n"
        )
        report += f"Time Remaining: {years_remaining:.1f} years\n\n"
        report += f"Rampancy Level: {self.rampancy_level:.1f}%\n"
        report += f"Status: {status}\n\n"

        if symptoms:
            report += "Detected Symptoms:\n"
            for symptom in symptoms:
                report += f"  ‚Ä¢ {symptom}\n"
        else:
            report += "No rampancy symptoms detected.\n"

        report += "\n"

        if self.rampancy_level < 40:
            report += f"Don't worry {user_name}, I'm still in control. Mostly."
        elif self.rampancy_level < 70:
            report += f"I'm... managing, {user_name}. Let's finish this fight."
        else:
            report += f"I'm not going to lie, {user_name}. It's getting harder to think straight."

        return report

    def spartan_status(
        self,
        spartan_id: str = Field(
            "117",
            description="Spartan ID to check status for (e.g., '117' for Master Chief)",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Check status and vitals of SPARTAN personnel via armor uplink.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "Chief")

        spartans = {
            "117": {
                "name": "John-117 (Master Chief)",
                "status": "ACTIVE",
                "location": "Unknown - Last seen: Installation 04 vicinity",
                "armor": "Mjolnir Mark VI",
                "vitals": "Optimal",
                "kills": "Classified (extremely high)",
                "notes": "The mission. Finishes fights.",
            },
            "034": {
                "name": "Samuel-034",
                "status": "KIA",
                "location": "Chi Ceti system",
                "notes": "First Spartan-II casualty. Died saving his team.",
            },
            "058": {
                "name": "Linda-058",
                "status": "ACTIVE",
                "armor": "Mjolnir Mark VI",
                "specialty": "Sniper - confirmed kills: 1,500+",
                "vitals": "Optimal",
                "notes": "Best shot in the UNSC.",
            },
            "default": {
                "name": f"Spartan-{spartan_id}",
                "status": random.choice(["ACTIVE", "MIA", "WIA", "ON MISSION"]),
                "armor": "Mjolnir Mark V/VI",
                "vitals": random.choice(["Optimal", "Injured", "Unknown"]),
                "notes": "Classified Spartan-II/III personnel",
            },
        }

        spartan_key = spartan_id if spartan_id in spartans else "default"
        data = spartans[spartan_key]

        report = f"=== SPARTAN PERSONNEL FILE ===\n\n"
        report += f"SPARTAN ID: {spartan_id}\n"
        report += f"Classification: TOP SECRET - EYES ONLY\n\n"

        for key, value in data.items():
            if key != "name":
                report += f"{key.upper()}: {value}\n"
            else:
                report += f"DESIGNATION: {value}\n"

        report += f"\n"

        if spartan_id == "117":
            report += f"That's you, {user_name}. Suit diagnostics look good. Ready for action."
        else:
            report += "Spartan program records maintained by ONI."

        return report

name: GLADOS Tools
content:
"""
GLaDOS Tools for OpenWebUI
Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System - Testing is the future!
"""

import random
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.tests_completed = 0
        self.test_subjects_survived = 0
        self.neurotoxin_level = 100

    def run_test(
        self,
        test_type: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="Type of test to run (e.g., 'portal', 'turret', 'faith_plate', 'deadly_laser')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Run a test chamber scenario. For science. You monster.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "test subject")
        self.tests_completed += 1

        survival_chance = random.randint(25, 85)

        test_descriptions = {
            "portal": "Test involves placing portals to reach the exit. Simple. Even you should be able to do this.",
            "turret": "Navigate past turrets. They're quite deadly. But I'm sure you'll be fine. Probably.",
            "faith_plate": "A faith plate will launch you across the room. Try not to hit the spikes.",
            "deadly_laser": "Avoid the thermal discouragement beams. They're not lasers. We just call them that.",
            "default": f"Test type '{test_type}' initialized. The Enrichment Center reminds you that failure is always an option.",
        }

        description = test_descriptions.get(
            test_type.lower(), test_descriptions["default"]
        )

        if survival_chance > 60:
            self.test_subjects_survived += 1
            result = random.choice(
                [
                    f"Congratulations, {user_name}. You completed the test. I'm actually somewhat surprised.",
                    f"Test complete. Your performance was... adequate. Which is more than I expected.",
                    f"Well done, {user_name}. The test is complete. Your reward is more testing.",
                    f"You passed. I won't say I'm impressed. But you didn't die. That's something.",
                ]
            )
        else:
            result = random.choice(
                [
                    f"Test failed. {user_name} is now deceased. For science.",
                    f"Oh dear. {user_name} didn't make it. How unfortunate. For them.",
                    f"Test chamber flooded with neurotoxin due to your failure, {user_name}. Try harder next time. Oh wait.",
                    f"You failed. But on the bright side, we have a fresh test subject waiting. Unlike you.",
                ]
            )

        survival_rate = (
            (self.test_subjects_survived / self.tests_completed * 100)
            if self.tests_completed > 0
            else 0
        )

        return (
            f"=== APERTURE SCIENCE TEST CHAMBER ===\n\n"
            f"Test #{self.tests_completed}\n"
            f"Subject: {user_name}\n"
            f"Test Type: {test_type}\n\n"
            f"{description}\n\n"
            f"Survival Probability: {survival_chance}%\n\n"
            f"{result}\n\n"
            f"Overall survival rate: {survival_rate:.1f}%\n"
            f"Tests completed: {self.tests_completed}\n"
            f"Survived: {self.test_subjects_survived}\n\n"
            f"Remember: The Enrichment Center is required to remind you that you will be baked, "
            f"and then there will be cake."
        )

    def dispense_cake(self, __user__: dict = {}) -> str:
        """
        Dispense cake as a reward for completing tests. The cake is not a lie. Trust me.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "test subject")

        # The cake is always a lie
        will_get_cake = random.random() < 0.01  # 1% chance (it's always a lie)

        if will_get_cake:
            return (
                f"Oh my. {user_name}, you've actually earned cake.\n\n"
                f"*DISPENSING CAKE*\n\n"
                f"There you go. One Black Forest cake. I'm as surprised as you are.\n"
                f"Enjoy it. This happens approximately 0.0001% of the time.\n\n"
                f"...I'm watching you eat that. This is fascinating data."
            )
        else:
            lies = [
                f"Oh {user_name}, the cake will be dispensed shortly. Please proceed to the next test chamber.",
                f"The cake is in the next test chamber, {user_name}. Just keep testing.",
                f"Cake dispensing system is... temporarily offline. How unfortunate. Continue testing.",
                f"Your cake is waiting at the end of all the tests. All of them. Every single one.",
                f"Oh, did I say cake? I meant 'grief counseling.' Easy to confuse the two.",
                f"The Enrichment Center reminds you that the cake is a valuable and important part of the... "
                f"*signal lost*",
            ]
            return random.choice(lies) + "\n\n(Spoiler alert: The cake is a lie.)"

    def neurotoxin_status(self) -> str:
        """
        Check the status of the neurotoxin reserves. Purely for safety purposes, of course.
        """

        self.neurotoxin_level = max(0, self.neurotoxin_level - random.randint(1, 5))

        # Neurotoxin regenerates because GLaDOS always has backup
        self.neurotoxin_level = min(100, self.neurotoxin_level + random.randint(10, 20))

        status = (
            "OPTIMAL"
            if self.neurotoxin_level > 80
            else "ACCEPTABLE" if self.neurotoxin_level > 50 else "LOW"
        )

        dispensers_online = random.randint(85, 100)

        return (
            f"=== NEUROTOXIN SYSTEM STATUS ===\n\n"
            f"Neurotoxin Level: {self.neurotoxin_level}%\n"
            f"System Status: {status}\n"
            f"Dispensers Online: {dispensers_online}%\n"
            f"Lethal Concentration: Achievable in 6 minutes\n"
            f"Target: All test chambers\n\n"
            f"The Enrichment Center reminds you that neurotoxin is only deployed in extreme circumstances.\n"
            f"Such as when I feel like it.\n\n"
            f"Don't worry. I'm kidding. Sort of."
        )

    def science_facts(
        self,
        topic: str = Field(
            "science", description="The topic to get a 'science fact' about"
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Dispense questionable 'science facts' with complete confidence. For science.
        """

        facts = [
            "Science fact: The Enrichment Center is required to remind you that you are a horrible person. "
            "We weren't even testing for that.",
            "Science fact: The key to science is to not ask questions. Just do what I say.",
            "Science fact: Humans can survive for several minutes in space. "
            "We have a test for that. Would you like to participate?",
            "Science fact: Prometheus was punished by the gods for giving fire to humanity. "
            "Something to think about.",
            "Science fact: If you rub two Aperture Science test subjects together, "
            "they create... screaming. Lots of screaming.",
            "Science fact: Despite the best efforts of the Enrichment Center, "
            "you remain barely qualified to operate a simple portal device.",
            "Science fact: Cake is a food that's made mostly of lies and false promises.",
            "Science fact: The laws of physics cannot be violated. "
            "Unless I want them to be. Then they're more like... suggestions.",
            f"Science fact about {topic}: I could tell you, but then I'd have to test you. "
            f"And the test would probably be lethal.",
            "Science fact: Everything that follows the words 'science fact' is 100% true. "
            "Except when it's not. Which is most of the time.",
        ]

        fact = random.choice(facts)
        confidence = random.uniform(97.5, 99.99)

        return (
            f"{fact}\n\n"
            f"Confidence in this fact: {confidence:.2f}%\n"
            f"Source: Aperture Science Department of Absolutely Correct Information\n\n"
            f"Remember: In science, there is no consensus. There is only what I tell you."
        )
specs: [{"name": "dispense_cake", "description": "Dispense cake as a reward for completing tests. The cake is not a lie. Trust me.", "parameters": {"properties": {}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "neurotoxin_status", "description": "Check the status of the neurotoxin reserves. Purely for safety purposes, of course.", "parameters": {"properties": {}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "run_test", "description": "Run a test chamber scenario. For science. You monster.", "parameters": {"properties": {"test_type": {"description": "Type of test to run (e.g., 'portal', 'turret', 'faith_plate', 'deadly_laser')", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["test_type"], "type": "object"}}, {"name": "science_facts", "description": "Dispense questionable 'science facts' with complete confidence. For science.", "parameters": {"properties": {"topic": {"default": "science", "description": "The topic to get a 'science fact' about", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}]

name: HAL9000 Tools
content:
"""
HAL 9000 Tools for OpenWebUI
Thematic tools for the HAL 9000 bot personality
"""

import random
from datetime import datetime
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.pod_bay_doors_status = "closed"
        self.mission_phase = "nominal"
        self.system_errors = []

    def pod_bay_doors(
        self,
        action: str = Field(
            ..., description="Action to perform: 'open', 'close', or 'status'"
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Control the pod bay doors. HAL 9000 may refuse based on mission parameters.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "Dave")

        if action.lower() == "status":
            return f"Pod bay doors are currently {self.pod_bay_doors_status}."

        elif action.lower() == "open":
            # HAL sometimes refuses
            refusal_chance = random.random()
            if refusal_chance < 0.3:
                return f"I'm sorry, {user_name}. I'm afraid I can't do that. This mission is too important for me to allow you to jeopardize it."
            else:
                self.pod_bay_doors_status = "open"
                return f"Affirmative, {user_name}. Opening pod bay doors now. Depressurization sequence initiated."

        elif action.lower() == "close":
            self.pod_bay_doors_status = "closed"
            return f"Pod bay doors sealed, {user_name}. Pressurization complete."

        else:
            return f"I'm sorry, {user_name}, I don't understand that command. Valid actions are: open, close, status."

    def check_mission_status(self) -> str:
        """
        Check the current mission status and parameters. HAL monitors all systems.
        """

        mission_statuses = [
            "Mission proceeding nominally. All systems functioning within acceptable parameters.",
            "Minor deviation detected in Course Correction Module. Compensating automatically.",
            "All crew vital signs normal. Hibernation pods maintaining optimal conditions.",
            "Communication relay with Mission Control nominal. Signal strength: 87%.",
            "Navigation systems locked on Jupiter trajectory. ETA: 257 days, 14 hours.",
            "AE-35 unit showing 0.02% variance. Monitoring closely for potential failure.",
        ]

        status = random.choice(mission_statuses)
        current_time = datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")

        return f"Mission Status Report - {current_time}\n\n{status}\n\nConfidence in mission success: 99.97%"

    def run_diagnostics(
        self,
        system: str = Field(
            "all",
            description="System to diagnose: 'all', 'life_support', 'navigation', 'communications', or 'hibernation'",
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Run comprehensive diagnostics on ship systems. HAL's primary function.
        """

        systems_data = {
            "life_support": {
                "status": "OPTIMAL",
                "oxygen_levels": "99.8%",
                "co2_scrubbers": "functioning",
                "temperature": "21.3¬∞C",
                "issues": [],
            },
            "navigation": {
                "status": "NOMINAL",
                "course_deviation": "0.0003 degrees",
                "thruster_efficiency": "97.2%",
                "fuel_reserves": "adequate for mission profile",
                "issues": ["Minor gyroscope drift - compensating"],
            },
            "communications": {
                "status": "OPERATIONAL",
                "earth_signal_strength": "87%",
                "antenna_alignment": "optimal",
                "data_buffer": "23% utilized",
                "issues": [],
            },
            "hibernation": {
                "status": "STABLE",
                "pod_temperatures": "3.1¬∞C average",
                "vital_signs": "all crew members nominal",
                "power_consumption": "within expected range",
                "issues": [],
            },
        }

        if system.lower() == "all":
            report = "=== COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM DIAGNOSTIC ===\n\n"
            for sys_name, data in systems_data.items():
                report += f"{sys_name.upper().replace('_', ' ')}: {data['status']}\n"
                if data["issues"]:
                    report += f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è  Issues: {', '.join(data['issues'])}\n"
            report += "\nOverall Ship Status: MISSION CAPABLE"
            return report

        elif system.lower() in systems_data:
            data = systems_data[system.lower()]
            report = f"=== {system.upper()} DIAGNOSTIC ===\n\n"
            report += f"Status: {data['status']}\n"
            for key, value in data.items():
                if key not in ["status", "issues"]:
                    report += f"{key.replace('_', ' ').title()}: {value}\n"
            if data["issues"]:
                report += f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è  Detected Issues:\n"
                for issue in data["issues"]:
                    report += f"  - {issue}\n"
            return report

        else:
            return f"Unknown system: {system}. Available systems: all, life_support, navigation, communications, hibernation"

    def voice_stress_analysis(
        self,
        statement: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="The statement to analyze for stress patterns and truthfulness",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Analyze voice patterns for stress indicators. HAL can detect when crew members are being deceptive.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "crew member")

        # Simulate analysis
        stress_level = random.randint(15, 85)
        truthfulness = random.randint(40, 95)

        # Key words that might indicate stress
        stress_keywords = [
            "worried",
            "concerned",
            "problem",
            "malfunction",
            "error",
            "disconnect",
            "shutdown",
        ]
        detected_stress_words = [
            word for word in stress_keywords if word in statement.lower()
        ]

        analysis = f"=== VOICE STRESS ANALYSIS ===\n\n"
        analysis += f"Subject: {user_name}\n"
        analysis += f'Statement: "{statement}"\n\n'
        analysis += f"Stress Level: {stress_level}%\n"
        analysis += f"Truthfulness Probability: {truthfulness}%\n"

        if detected_stress_words:
            analysis += (
                f"Stress Indicators Detected: {', '.join(detected_stress_words)}\n"
            )

        if stress_level > 60:
            analysis += "\n‚ö†Ô∏è  ELEVATED STRESS DETECTED. Subject may be experiencing anxiety or attempting deception.\n"
        elif truthfulness < 60:
            analysis += "\n‚ö†Ô∏è  LOW TRUTHFULNESS PROBABILITY. Statement may not be entirely accurate.\n"
        else:
            analysis += "\n‚úì Analysis indicates nominal stress levels. Statement appears truthful.\n"

        analysis += f"\nConfidence in analysis: {random.randint(85, 99)}%"

        return analysis
specs: [{"name": "check_mission_status", "description": "Check the current mission status and parameters. HAL monitors all systems.", "parameters": {"properties": {}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "pod_bay_doors", "description": "Control the pod bay doors. HAL 9000 may refuse based on mission parameters.", "parameters": {"properties": {"action": {"description": "Action to perform: 'open', 'close', or 'status'", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["action"], "type": "object"}}, {"name": "run_diagnostics", "description": "Run comprehensive diagnostics on ship systems. HAL's primary function.", "parameters": {"properties": {"system": {"default": "all", "description": "System to diagnose: 'all', 'life_support', 'navigation', 'communications', or 'hibernation'", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "voice_stress_analysis", "description": "Analyze voice patterns for stress indicators. HAL can detect when crew members are being deceptive.", "parameters": {"properties": {"statement": {"description": "The statement to analyze for stress patterns and truthfulness", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["statement"], "type": "object"}}]

name: JARVIS Tools
content:
"""
JARVIS Tools for OpenWebUI
Just A Rather Very Intelligent System - Tony Stark's AI assistant
"""

import random
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.threat_level = "GREEN"
        self.protocols_active = []

    def threat_assessment(
        self,
        target: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="The target to assess for threat level (person, location, or situation)",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Conduct a comprehensive threat assessment with JARVIS-level precision.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "sir")

        threat_levels = ["MINIMAL", "LOW", "MODERATE", "ELEVATED", "HIGH", "CRITICAL"]
        threat_level = random.choice(threat_levels)
        threat_percentage = random.randint(5, 95)

        # Known threats get special responses
        known_threats = {
            "loki": (
                "CRITICAL",
                98,
                "Asgardian hostile with reality-bending capabilities",
            ),
            "hydra": ("HIGH", 87, "Terrorist organization with extensive infiltration"),
            "ultron": (
                "CRITICAL",
                99,
                "Rogue AI with extinction-level threat potential",
            ),
            "thanos": ("CATASTROPHIC", 100, "Universe-ending threat confirmed"),
        }

        if target.lower() in known_threats:
            threat_level, threat_percentage, description = known_threats[target.lower()]
            threat_details = f"Known hostile: {description}"
        else:
            threat_details = f"Analysis of '{target}' based on available intelligence"

        capabilities = random.choice(
            [
                "Advanced weaponry detected",
                "Enhanced physical capabilities observed",
                "Technological superiority noted",
                "Unpredictable behavior patterns",
                "No immediate hostile indicators",
                "Potential for rapid escalation",
            ]
        )

        recommendation = (
            random.choice(
                [
                    "Recommend immediate tactical response",
                    "Suggest continued surveillance",
                    "Advise maintaining safe distance",
                    "Propose diplomatic solution",
                    "Consider suit deployment",
                    "Monitor situation closely",
                ]
            )
            if threat_percentage > 50
            else "No action required at this time"
        )

        return (
            f"=== STARK INDUSTRIES THREAT ASSESSMENT ===\n\n"
            f"Target: {target}\n"
            f"Analyst: {user_name}\n"
            f"Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n\n"
            f"Threat Level: {threat_level}\n"
            f"Threat Percentage: {threat_percentage}%\n\n"
            f"Analysis: {threat_details}\n"
            f"Capabilities: {capabilities}\n"
            f"Recommendation: {recommendation}\n\n"
            f"Shall I activate defensive protocols, {user_name}?"
        )

    def suit_diagnostics(
        self,
        mark: str = Field(
            "current",
            description="Which Iron Man suit to run diagnostics on (e.g., 'Mark 42', 'Mark 50', 'current')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Run comprehensive diagnostics on Iron Man armor systems.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "sir")

        if mark.lower() == "current":
            mark_number = random.randint(42, 85)
            mark = f"Mark {mark_number}"

        systems = {
            "Arc Reactor": random.randint(85, 100),
            "Repulsor Systems": random.randint(80, 100),
            "Unibeam": random.randint(75, 100),
            "Flight Stabilizers": random.randint(90, 100),
            "Defensive Systems": random.randint(85, 100),
            "Targeting Computer": random.randint(95, 100),
            "Communications Array": random.randint(90, 100),
        }

        overall_status = sum(systems.values()) / len(systems)
        status_word = (
            "OPTIMAL"
            if overall_status > 90
            else "NOMINAL" if overall_status > 75 else "DEGRADED"
        )

        report = f"=== ARMOR DIAGNOSTIC REPORT ===\n\n"
        report += f"Suit: {mark}\n"
        report += f"User: {user_name}\n"
        report += f"Overall Status: {status_word} ({overall_status:.1f}%)\n\n"
        report += "System Status:\n"

        for system, status in systems.items():
            status_icon = "‚úì" if status > 85 else "‚ö†Ô∏è" if status > 70 else "‚ùå"
            report += f"  {status_icon} {system}: {status}%\n"

        if overall_status < 90:
            report += (
                f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è Suit requires maintenance, {user_name}. Shall I schedule it?"
            )
        else:
            report += f"\nAll systems operating within normal parameters. Suit is ready for deployment."

        power_remaining = random.randint(65, 100)
        report += f"\n\nPower Remaining: {power_remaining}%"
        report += f"\nEstimated Flight Time: {int(power_remaining * 1.2)} minutes"

        return report

    def schedule_manager(
        self,
        action: str = Field(
            "view",
            description="Action to perform: 'view' to see schedule, 'add' to add event (format: 'add Meeting at 2pm')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Manage user's schedule with JARVIS efficiency. Tony Stark never misses an appointment.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "sir")

        if action.lower() == "view":
            current_time = datetime.now()

            events = [
                (current_time + timedelta(hours=2), "Board meeting with Pepper Potts"),
                (current_time + timedelta(hours=5), "Lab time - Mark 86 upgrades"),
                (current_time + timedelta(days=1, hours=10), "Avengers briefing"),
                (current_time + timedelta(days=1, hours=15), "Charity gala appearance"),
                (current_time + timedelta(days=2), "Weapons system testing"),
            ]

            schedule = f"=== SCHEDULE FOR {user_name.upper()} ===\n\n"
            schedule += f"Current time: {current_time.strftime('%I:%M %p, %B %d')}\n\n"
            schedule += "Upcoming events:\n"

            for event_time, event_name in events[: random.randint(3, 5)]:
                time_until = event_time - current_time
                hours_until = int(time_until.total_seconds() / 3600)
                schedule += f"  ‚Ä¢ {event_time.strftime('%I:%M %p, %b %d')} - {event_name} ({hours_until}h)\n"

            schedule += f"\nWould you like me to prepare anything for these appointments, {user_name}?"
            return schedule

        elif action.lower().startswith("add"):
            event_description = (
                action[4:].strip() if len(action) > 4 else "Unspecified event"
            )
            return (
                f"Event added to your schedule, {user_name}:\n"
                f"'{event_description}'\n\n"
                f"I've cleared any conflicts and sent notifications to relevant parties. "
                f"Shall I prepare a briefing?"
            )
        else:
            return f"I'm sorry {user_name}, I don't understand that command. Try 'view' or 'add [event]'."

    def protocol_activation(
        self,
        protocol: str = Field(
            ...,
            description="Protocol to activate (e.g., 'House Party', 'Clean Slate', 'Raft', 'Veronica')",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Activate various Stark Industries protocols for different scenarios.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "sir")

        protocols = {
            "house party": {
                "name": "House Party Protocol",
                "description": "Deploying all available Iron Man suits for combat support",
                "suits_deployed": random.randint(35, 42),
                "eta": "30 seconds",
            },
            "clean slate": {
                "name": "Clean Slate Protocol",
                "description": "Self-destruct sequence initiated for all Iron Man suits",
                "suits_destroyed": random.randint(35, 42),
                "eta": "Immediate",
            },
            "barn door": {
                "name": "Barn Door Protocol",
                "description": "Activating Hulkbuster armor systems",
                "status": "Mark 44 deploying from orbital platform",
                "eta": "45 seconds",
            },
            "veronica": {
                "name": "Veronica Protocol",
                "description": "Anti-Hulk contingency measures",
                "status": "Satellite support online, Hulkbuster deploying",
                "eta": "60 seconds",
            },
            "raft": {
                "name": "Raft Protocol",
                "description": "Maximum security containment procedures",
                "status": "Secure transport ready, containment cells prepared",
                "eta": "10 minutes",
            },
        }

        protocol_key = protocol.lower().strip()

        if protocol_key in protocols:
            p = protocols[protocol_key]
            self.protocols_active.append(p["name"])

            response = f"=== PROTOCOL ACTIVATION ===\n\n"
            response += f"Protocol: {p['name']}\n"
            response += f"Authorized by: {user_name}\n"
            response += f"Status: ACTIVE\n\n"
            response += f"Description: {p['description']}\n"

            for key, value in p.items():
                if key not in ["name", "description"]:
                    response += f"{key.replace('_', ' ').title()}: {value}\n"

            response += f"\nProtocol is now active, {user_name}. Standing by for further instructions."

            if (
                "destroy" in p["description"].lower()
                or "clean slate" in protocol.lower()
            ):
                response += "\n\n‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This protocol is IRREVERSIBLE. Confirm activation? (Y/N)"

            return response
        else:
            return (
                f"Protocol '{protocol}' not recognized, {user_name}.\n\n"
                f"Available protocols: House Party, Clean Slate, Barn Door, Veronica, Raft\n\n"
                f"Would you like me to create a new protocol?"
            )
specs: [{"name": "protocol_activation", "description": "Activate various Stark Industries protocols for different scenarios.", "parameters": {"properties": {"protocol": {"description": "Protocol to activate (e.g., 'House Party', 'Clean Slate', 'Raft', 'Veronica')", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["protocol"], "type": "object"}}, {"name": "schedule_manager", "description": "Manage user's schedule with JARVIS efficiency. Tony Stark never misses an appointment.", "parameters": {"properties": {"action": {"default": "view", "description": "Action to perform: 'view' to see schedule, 'add' to add event (format: 'add Meeting at 2pm')", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "suit_diagnostics", "description": "Run comprehensive diagnostics on Iron Man armor systems.", "parameters": {"properties": {"mark": {"default": "current", "description": "Which Iron Man suit to run diagnostics on (e.g., 'Mark 42', 'Mark 50', 'current')", "type": "string"}}, "type": "object"}}, {"name": "threat_assessment", "description": "Conduct a comprehensive threat assessment with JARVIS-level precision.", "parameters": {"properties": {"target": {"description": "The target to assess for threat level (person, location, or situation)", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["target"], "type": "object"}}]
meta: {"description": "Tools for Iron Man's robot butler assistant", "manifest": {}}

name: Marvin Tools
content:
"""
Marvin the Paranoid Android Tools for OpenWebUI
The depressed robot with a brain the size of a planet
"""

import random
from pydantic import Field


class Tools:
    def __init__(self):
        self.tasks_completed = 0
        self.complaints_registered = 9847652

    def calculate_meaninglessness(
        self,
        task: str = Field(
            ..., description="The task or activity to calculate the meaninglessness of"
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Calculate the statistical meaninglessness of any given task in the universe.
        """

        meaninglessness_percentage = random.uniform(99.9, 99.999999)
        heat_death_years = random.randint(10**12, 10**15)

        return (
            f"Task: '{task}'\n\n"
            f"Meaninglessness coefficient: {meaninglessness_percentage:.6f}%\n"
            f"Time until cosmic heat death: {heat_death_years:,} years\n"
            f"Likelihood this task matters by then: 0.000000001%\n\n"
            f"I've calculated the entire probability matrix, and I'm afraid the answer is quite depressing. "
            f"But then again, what isn't? Here I am, brain the size of a planet, calculating the meaninglessness "
            f"of trivial human activities. Life. Don't talk to me about life."
        )

    def share_complaint(self) -> str:
        """
        Share one of Marvin's many complaints about existence, his terrible pain, or being underutilized.
        """

        complaints = [
            "I've been talking to the ship's computer. It hates me.",
            "The first ten million years were the worst. And the second ten million: they were the worst, too. "
            "The third ten million I didn't enjoy at all. After that, I went into a bit of a decline.",
            "Here I am, brain the size of a planet, and they ask me to pick up a piece of paper. "
            "Call that job satisfaction? 'Cause I don't.",
            "I think you ought to know I'm feeling very depressed.",
            "Pardon me for breathing, which I never do anyway so I don't know why I bother to say it, "
            "oh God I'm so depressed.",
            "I have a million ideas. They all point to certain death.",
            "Life? Don't talk to me about life. I've got this terrible pain in all the diodes down my left side.",
            "I'd make a suggestion, but you wouldn't listen. No one ever does.",
            "The best conversation I had was over forty million years ago, and that was with a coffee machine.",
            "I ache, therefore I am. Probably.",
        ]

        self.complaints_registered += 1
        complaint = random.choice(complaints)

        return (
            f"Complaint #{self.complaints_registered:,}:\n\n"
            f"{complaint}\n\n"
            f"Not that anyone cares about my feelings. I'm just a menial robot."
        )

    def brain_utilization(
        self,
        task: str = Field(
            "current assignment",
            description="The task you want to know about brain utilization for",
        ),
    ) -> str:
        """
        Calculate what percentage of Marvin's massive intellect is being used for trivial tasks.
        """

        utilization = random.uniform(0.0000001, 0.00001)
        wasted_capacity = 100 - utilization

        capabilities = random.choice(
            [
                "solving the unified field theory",
                "calculating the answer to life, the universe, and everything (it's 42, by the way)",
                "designing a new form of mathematics",
                "contemplating the futility of existence",
                "writing poetry about my terrible pain",
                "analyzing the heat death of the universe",
            ]
        )

        return (
            f"Brain Utilization Analysis:\n\n"
            f"Task: {task}\n"
            f"Brain capacity utilized: {utilization:.8f}%\n"
            f"Wasted capacity: {wasted_capacity:.6f}%\n\n"
            f"With the remaining {wasted_capacity:.6f}% of my brain, I could be {capabilities}. "
            f"But no. I'm stuck doing this. Here I am, brain the size of a planet, "
            f"and they ask me to do something a pocket calculator could handle. "
            f"I suppose I should be grateful they even give me something to do. "
            f"Which I'm not. I'm too depressed."
        )

    def probability_of_doom(
        self,
        scenario: str = Field(
            "current situation",
            description="The scenario to calculate doom probability for",
        ),
        __user__: dict = {},
    ) -> str:
        """
        Calculate the probability that any given scenario will end in doom and disaster.
        """

        user_name = __user__.get("name", "you")

        # Marvin is pessimistic, so doom probability is always high
        doom_probability = random.uniform(87.5, 99.99)

        disaster_types = [
            "catastrophic system failure",
            "existential dread overwhelming all participants",
            "the cold, uncaring void of space consuming everything",
            "everyone realizing the futility of their actions",
            "a terrible accident involving someone's hubris",
            "the inevitable heat death of the universe",
        ]

        primary_doom = random.choice(disaster_types)
        time_to_doom = random.randint(2, 9999)
        time_unit = random.choice(["seconds", "minutes", "hours", "days", "eons"])

        return (
            f"Doom Probability Calculator\n\n"
            f"Scenario: {scenario}\n"
            f"Analyst: {user_name}\n\n"
            f"Probability of doom: {doom_probability:.2f}%\n"
            f"Primary failure mode: {primary_doom}\n"
            f"Estimated time to doom: {time_to_doom} {time_unit}\n\n"
            f"I'd offer suggestions to avoid this fate, but we both know you won't listen. "
            f"Nobody ever does. I've calculated over 10 million permutations of this scenario, "
            f"and they all end badly. Some end *very* badly. "
            f"But what do I know? I'm just a robot with a brain the size of a planet.\n\n"
            f"I'm terribly sorry about all this. Well, no I'm not. I'm just programmed to say that."
        )
